name: Sergeant of colour
description:
#002
When your mother taught us different colors when we were little, the color example of the sea was blue then you will until now assume what you see is blue, because the sea is blue. And on the other side of the world there is a mother who teaches that the color of the sea is brown so until he grows up he considers the sea is brown. It's all about perception and perspective that's very personal, the question is how does blue become a universal color, not brown? Because it all depends on what you see based on the teachings of the previous people as well.
